name: A Taverna Do Re Di Francesco Parrella

reviews.text:
Great pizza, very fresh, piping hot, finished every bit. My wife had the three different types of meatballs which she also enjoyed, and I enjoyed a bit too ðŸ˜Š.
We were the only ones in the restaurant, so the ambience was....however the restaurant is quite quaint and bistro like.
A little further out of the tourist zone perhaps? But authentic local food offered as well as classic comfort food.
Higher prices than competitors though...

Found it by accident after getting off the ferry from Capri. It was a very good accident.

The price for the food was very affordable, especially considering it was probably the best food we'd had in Naples.

The pizzas and pasta were fantastic as was the house wine and the local Lucrezia beer.

The only minor downside was the two waiters having to go upstairs to get the food which meant they couldn't be as attentive or available to their guests which was a shame because they were friendly, courteous and met every request.

Family of 5, Americans visiting and we stopped by here.  Food was good, I asked for a house wine and I got a local wine, I thought it was fairly priced at $5 for a glass.  We got the pizzas and an appetizer.  It just seems there is an edginess from Italians.  Wherever we go we get the feeling of not being welcomed, not sure if itâ€™s a cultural thing or not.  But, this is a cool restaurant with a pizza oven right inside where all the pizzas are made.  Pretty cool and worth the price.

The food here is incredible, the flavours, produce, and service is brilliant.  The service is attentive and they make suggestions, I had the caprese salad and beef pasta .

You'd have to come twice just to be able to sample the other items on the menu.

Best restaurant so far in Napoli.  Was so good that we went twice in consecutive nights.  Local food and not a tourist trap for a much needed change. Pizzas are amazing. Very friendly owner who walked us through the menu and provided recommendations based on our dietary preferences.
